body_html:
Should we report this to bazel? Changing the workspace file is cheating, in
a way. I don't know many build systems that can work with that, but maybe
bazel should aspire to more?
On Wed, Feb 10, 2016 at 17:53 Benoit Steiner notifications@github.com
wrote:

I have noticed that calling bazel clean every time you sync can help.
bazel caches a lot of build data internally and it may not always properly
react when the WORKSPACE file changes.

—
Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
#1033 (comment)
.

body:
Should we report this to bazel? Changing the workspace file is cheating, in
a way. I don't know many build systems that can work with that, but maybe
bazel should aspire to more?
On Wed, Feb 10, 2016 at 17:53 Benoit Steiner notifications@github.com
wrote:

> I have noticed that calling bazel clean every time you sync can help.
> bazel caches a lot of build data internally and it may not always properly
> react when the WORKSPACE file changes.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/1033#issuecomment-182670866
